body:
I can probably use https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/issues/2159 to get away with this without fixing the problem. Is there a snapshot repository I can use?

Tried to use a Gradle source dependency and that failed: https://github.com/andrewparmet/buf-gradle-plugin/runs/5959893413?check_suite_focus=true

```
Could not determine the dependencies of task ':compileTestKotlin'.
> Could not resolve all task dependencies for configuration ':testCompileClasspath'.
   > Could not find any version that matches org.junit.jupiter:junit-jupiter:5.9.0-SNAPSHOT.
     Searched in the following locations:
       - Git repository at https://github.com/junit-team/junit5.git
     Required by:
         project : > project :junit5:junit-jupiter > project :junit5:junit-bom
```

I've never seen a project depend on its own BOM? This looks a bit like a circular dependency. With https://github.com/andrewparmet/junit5/commit/37288c49de2f48d94f1fc1dda5b439bd84917931 to remove the circular dependency I'm able to use `CleanupMode`.

> Is there a snapshot repository I can use?

There used to be a description in the README of the repository -- which seems to be gone for good. ðŸ¤” 

Here are "code-as-documentation" variants using snapshot builds from JUnit's sample projects:

- [junit5-jupiter-starter-gradle](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5-samples/blob/main/junit5-jupiter-starter-gradle/build-SNAPSHOT.gradle)
- [junit5-jupiter-starter-maven](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5-samples/blob/main/junit5-jupiter-starter-maven/pom-SNAPSHOT.xml)
@sormuras I found a reference in the docs: https://junit.org/junit5/docs/current/user-guide/#dependency-metadata

issue.title: Remove BOM dependencies from artifacts defined in the BOM to enable participation in Gradle source dependencies

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
## Overview

While investigating solutions to https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/issues/2883 I attempted to use a Gradle [source dependency](https://blog.gradle.org/introducing-source-dependencies) to depend on the latest version of this project since I couldn't find a published snapshot.

The build with a source dependency failed due to what looks like a circular dependency: most artifacts have a dependency on a BOM that declares them (and hence depends on them).

```
Could not determine the dependencies of task ':compileTestKotlin'.
> Could not resolve all task dependencies for configuration ':testCompileClasspath'.
   > Could not find any version that matches org.junit.jupiter:junit-jupiter:5.9.0-SNAPSHOT.
     Searched in the following locations:
       - Git repository at https://github.com/junit-team/junit5.git
     Required by:
         project : > project :junit5:junit-jupiter > project :junit5:junit-bom
```

When I remove the circular dependency with this change the source dependency build succeeds.

Open questions:
- Is there a reason the BOM is used in this way?
- Should I try to add a test to cover this? Could be tricky.

---

I hereby agree to the terms of the [JUnit Contributor License Agreement](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/002a0052926ddee57cf90580fa49bc37e5a72427/CONTRIBUTING.md#junit-contributor-license-agreement).

---

### Definition of Done

- [x] There are no TODOs left in the code
- [x] Method [preconditions](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/api/org.junit.platform.commons/org/junit/platform/commons/util/Preconditions.html) are checked and documented in the method's Javadoc
- [x] [Coding conventions](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#coding-conventions) (e.g. for logging) have been followed
- [x] Change is covered by [automated tests](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#tests) including corner cases, errors, and exception handling
- [x] Public API has [Javadoc](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#javadoc) and [`@API` annotations](https://apiguardian-team.github.io/apiguardian/docs/current/api/org/apiguardian/api/API.html)
- [x] Change is documented in the [User Guide](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/) and [Release Notes](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/#release-notes)
- [x] All [continuous integration builds](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5#continuous-integration-builds) pass

body:
The current code should stop retrying for directories already being retried:
https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/8d8609a8005b40d51b2364983f9d5ef12f888173/junit-jupiter-engine/src/main/java/org/junit/jupiter/engine/extension/TempDirectory.java#L302

I'll take a stab at this.

issue.title: Only retry deleting directories when cleaning up `TempDir` once

body: @andrewparmet I've just merged a fix. Could you please try out the latest snapshot?

I tried the snapshot and the build no longer fails with a StackOverflowError - now I see the actual failure.

Here's the build: https://github.com/andrewparmet/buf-gradle-plugin/runs/5962954761?check_suite_focus=true

And here's the failure:
```
java.io.IOException: Failed to delete temp directory /tmp/junit15838421272742090151. The following paths could not be deleted (see suppressed exceptions for details): , build, build/bufbuild, build/bufbuild/generated, build/bufbuild/generated/java, build/bufbuild/generated/java/com, build/bufbuild/generated/java/com/parmet, build/bufbuild/generated/java/com/parmet/buf, build/bufbuild/generated/java/com/parmet/buf/test, build/bufbuild/generated/java/com/parmet/buf/test/v1, build/bufbuild/generated/java/com/parmet/buf/test/v1/Test.java

...

        Suppressed: java.nio.file.DirectoryNotEmptyException: /tmp/junit15838421272742090151
		at java.base/sun.nio.fs.UnixFileSystemProvider.implDelete(UnixFileSystemProvider.java:246)

		at java.base/java.nio.file.Files.delete(Files.java:1152)
		at org.junit.jupiter.engine.extension.TempDirectory$CloseablePath$1.deleteAndContinue(TempDirectory.java:293)
		at org.junit.jupiter.engine.extension.TempDirectory$CloseablePath$1.postVisitDirectory(TempDirectory.java:288)
		at org.junit.jupiter.engine.extension.TempDirectory$CloseablePath$1.postVisitDirectory(TempDirectory.java:264)

		at java.base/java.nio.file.Files.walkFileTree(Files.java:2882)

		at org.junit.jupiter.engine.extension.TempDirectory$CloseablePath.close(TempDirectory.java:249)
		... 77 more
	Suppressed: java.nio.file.DirectoryNotEmptyException: /tmp/junit15838421272742090151/build
		at java.base/sun.nio.fs.UnixFileSystemProvider.implDelete(UnixFileSystemProvider.java:246)
		at java.base/sun.nio.fs.AbstractFileSystemProvider.delete(AbstractFileSystemProvider.java:105)
		at java.base/java.nio.file.Files.delete(Files.java:1152)
		at org.junit.jupiter.engine.extension.TempDirectory$CloseablePath$1.deleteAndContinue(TempDirectory.java:293)
		at org.junit.jupiter.engine.extension.TempDirectory$CloseablePath$1.postVisitDirectory(TempDirectory.java:288)
		at org.junit.jupiter.engine.extension.TempDirectory$CloseablePath$1.postVisitDirectory(TempDirectory.java:264)

... all the way down to:

        Suppressed: java.nio.file.AccessDeniedException: /tmp/junit15838421272742090151/build/bufbuild/generated/java/com/parmet/buf/test/v1/Test.java

```

Looks like TempDir tries to give itself permissions. Is this potentially a bug or am I doing something unsupported that's a known limitation?
Yes, it does try to give itself permissions. Could you please check the file's owner and create a new issue with your findings?

issue.title: TempDir fails to clean up for certain files

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
Follow-up for #2883.

TempDir is failing to delete `Test.java` following a test (GenerateTest). This is a partial listing of the contents of the temporary directory including the problematic file:

```
./bufbuild/generated/java/com/parmet/buf/test/v1:
total 20
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root 17332 Apr 10 21:30 Test.java
```

In a separate test (PublishTest), `image.json` is also generated from a call to Docker but TempDir has no trouble deleting it:

```
./bufbuild:
total 4
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root 974 Apr 10 21:30 image.json
```

These logs are from build https://github.com/andrewparmet/buf-gradle-plugin/pull/59/checks?check_run_id=5963791559.

## Steps to reproduce

Run CI on https://github.com/andrewparmet/buf-gradle-plugin/pull/59.

## Context

 - Used versions (Jupiter/Vintage/Platform): c8fa9c371106ef5ab5d87d68abde4ead27a0ea5a
 - Build Tool/IDE: Gradle 7.4.1

cc @marcphilipp
